description:
**Problem**
`remote.fetch(&["refs/heads/beads/store"], ...)` relies on libgit2 refspec defaults; it may only update FETCH_HEAD and leave `refs/remotes/origin/beads/store` stale. Fetch errors are also ignored, so the daemon can sync against stale remote state without any signal.

**Design**
Use an explicit refspec (`refs/heads/beads/store:refs/remotes/origin/beads/store`) and return/propagate fetch errors (or at least surface them in status/IPC). Keep a best-effort path for offline reads but make failures visible.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] Fetch updates `refs/remotes/origin/beads/store`
- [ ] Fetch errors are surfaced (status/IPC/logs)
- [ ] Tests cover refspec + fetch failure behavior

**Files:** src/git/sync.rs, src/daemon/git_worker.rs
title: Git fetch should use explicit refspec + surface errors
